runs.comm: outside the off stump, Smith whips it with wristy cheekiness and they scamper a single to get off the mark
a swing and a miss from Ramdin! A lovely outswinger from Pollock, as Ramdin leans back and tries to whack this over the covers
and again he's beaten with a slightly more horrid stroke, poking at it off the back foot
ping! Where's this gone? He drives through the line but has skied it over the top...and it falls betwixt the long-on and long-off behind the bowler
neater stroke, guiding this behind square but an excellent dive to his right from backward point prevents the single
plants his foot and tries to flump this over cover but misses by a mile
"catch!" is the cry from Ntini as Smith clips this neatly off the back foot, guiding it behind square in the air. Third man is too deep, however
down the leg side, Boucher appeals for a catch. Surely that's a wide?
this cuts back into Ramdin who is beaten by the movement off the seam, trying to whip it to leg
what a ball that was, cutting back massively into Ramdin. Quick ball, too
spanked off the back foot but he doesn't time it and it flies to mid-off (yes, mid-off)...but it's short of the fielder. One of those unpredictable Twenty20 shots...
full toss; four. Hammered down the ground. The deepish mid-on doesn't have much hope
clattered over extra cover with immense extravagance, skipping down the pitch and carving it square
nudged out to the off side for a single
wide, Ramdin tries to uppercut it over third man but is beaten by the swing again
slower ball which he pumps to mid-on
excellent ball. He saw him coming, did Pollock, and sent down a slower ball which foxed him entirely
neat stroke, beating the short fine-leg as Smith clips this leg-side stray past him for four

swinging back into Ramdin who is again beaten by the movement off the pace. They try to steal a single but Ntini is so quick and flies past Smith, picking the ball up and flinging it onto the stumps. Superb work from Ntini
nasty delivery cutting back into Samuels who is hit in the groin, or perhaps just above the groin
excellent angle, again moving back into Samuels
ah, but Ntini is too straight here and, with the movement, it flies down to fine leg with a clip off the toes
horrid, tentative, pokey push forward and he's beaten
well, yet again he's rapped on the body - on the pads this time - to one which cuts back into him
beaten outside off. More swing for Pollock who draws him into this defensive poke
four! Classic Twenty20 slogging there as Ramdin unleashes his bat, with no care or sense of where he wanted to hit it, and somehow got a thick inside edge which flew down to fine leg
an almighty swish from Ramdin but it hammers into his pads
a cracker! What a beauty from Pollock. He's been swinging them away so far, but this holds its line and beats his defensive push
cautiously back in his crease, it's a little too straight from Pollock and they steal a single
miles wide of the off stump. He tries to launch it out of the ground but misses
another nasty inducker which Ramdin just waits for, expecting it to hit him, and they steal a single
gone! Samuels steps to leg and tries to slap this over cover, but gets a thick outside edge. It flies to Boucher who takes a good catch above his head
well wide of the off stump and, at last, Jerling calls a wide
massive movement, cutting away from the left hander
what a ball that is. Angling across Chanderpaul before it cuts back into him hugely, and Boucher appeals for a caught behind
and this angles across him and again he is beaten! Wonderful bowling
left alone this time
swing and a miss outside off
more great movement, far too good for the batsman who swings and misses
a touch wider, he tries to spank it over the top but misses
well, you can't play that. Wonderful start from Morkel, angling into the right hander before swinging it away
driven past the bowler for a single, but there's no great power in the stroke
banana swing into Chanderpaul's pads who nudges it off his leg for a single
well bowled. It cuts away from Chanderpaul who's rapped on the gloves
wide of the off stump, Chanderpaul crouches and pokes and guides this down to third man
ping! Much too full, on his pads, Ramdin just flicks it over midwicket for six. Beautifully clipped
wide, wide, wide and called wide
excellent reply from Morkel, a much better line and it draws him into a drive
gone! Excellent ball, again drawing Ramdin into a drive but it moves off the seam and flies straight to the lone slip
well wide but for some reason not called a wide
a huge, throaty and rather impressive appeal from Morkel who raps Chanderpaul on the pads but it's going down leg by a mile
lovely ball, swinging away from the right hander who swings and misses
more huge movement, and shorter too, and he misses...
full, squeezed out to cover on the front foot
down the leg side, Boucher dives to save the wide. But again it's not called wide!
bang! That's more like it. It was in the slot and he clattered it over midwicket for four
nudges this off his glove, or backside, or leg, or something bodily
short, good lift, Boucher takes it in front of his face
ooh that was close. A thick inside edge as he tries to whack this over midwicket
excellent delivery, angling into Chanderpaul before it cuts away from him. No chance of playing that
clipped back to the bowler
punched to cover
defended on the front foot
down the pitch, clipped to leg
he walks into this stroke and guides it out to a wide long-off
on the sweep, it flies off his pad and Boucher scrambles to catch it but can't reach
pushed back to him
full, straight and he's beaten
nudged to leg and they could get two here but Smith sprints round from point to save the extra run
bang! That's a great shot, clumping it over midwicket for four. Immense power
short, outside off but it beats Morton's cut
again short and this time he connects with a cut, but finds cover
clipped to fine-leg for a single
clumped to long-on
well that's an unfortunate way to go. Morton tried to sweep, the ball coming off his glove or arm and bobbled back onto the stumps
clipped straight to midwicket
worked to long-on
squeezed out to the off side
full, outside off and cracked out to the deep
full toss on his pads, Chanderpaul drops his knee and swings it behind square
Chanderpaul nudges to leg
quality stroke, lofting this over long-off for six. Beautiful shot - he just held his pose and smacked through the line
swept to deep square leg
a full toss, Chanderpaul smites it through midwicket
excellent bowling. A good slower ball, foxing Chanderpaul in the flight who tried to punch it over cover, but the ball ballooned meekly to Botha at point
down the leg side, turning massively and that's rightly called a wide
hello - that's massive. Monstrous shot, pile-driving it over the top
and immediately, the right line and length - a touch of nibble off the seam - and he's beaten on the front foot
again, this swings away from Lewis's dodgy smash-and-run
that's a ripper of a delivery! Swinging and seaming away from his forward push. You simply cannot play those...
awful shot. Full and straight, he tries to clobber this over long-on but skies it straight down mid-on's throat
patted down to third man. He wasn't sure whether to play at it or leave it well alone...
punched out to cover
blimey, that's beaten everyone! It spins past his outside edge, spins past Boucher and flies down to fine leg
well flighted, beating him in the air; he tries to whack it over the top but misses, and Boucher misses a stumping too
flicked through midwicket
huge shout from keeper and bowler but it's going down the leg side
full and down the leg side
sweetly clipped to midwicket but, again, only for a single
driven on the up, square, and it flies over backward point
short, he tries to uppercut it over third man but can only get a single
beaten by a cracker - excellent, intelligent bowling this. Nice and full, giving it every chance to swing, and it beats the batsman's ambitious drive
shorter and it hammers into his body
another marvellous delivery, drawing him into a drive and it swings past his outside edge
good cricket. Shorter, and he nudges to leg and set off for two. Really good running, that
drifting down the leg side, a wild delivery which brushes his arm guard
cracking cut shot, hammering it off the back foot but he can't find the gap
blimey that's harsh. It cuts him in half - no chance of making contact with that
pushed off the back foot straight to the bowler
easy catch for long-on as Bravo mistimes this, attempting to loft it over the top but finds the fielder
shorter, he steps to leg and rather fends it out to the off side
that is a monstrous hit, pinging it over midwicket - incredibly high, and in fact it only just sails over for six
swinging wide of the off stump
I don't know how to describe that. He shuffled to the leg side and cowed it over the top. A nervous slap, if you like
brilliant! Hilarious stuff here as he tries to step to the off side, but the ball follows him, hits him, and they run a single. Calamity upon calamity
madness. A swing and a miss. Boucher parries to first slip to produce a good throw, as the batsman take a single, but he throws to the wrong end!
more frenzied running here - Boucher, this time, tries to hit the stumps but misses

he tries to clatter this over midwicket but seems to have lost his arm in the process. He's sunk to the ground and doesn't look in great shape here, clutching his arm. Perhaps it really has come out of its socket? But either way he's good to continue. As my mother would say, he's got another arm...
this is huge from Sammy! A monstrous short-arm pull high and handsome over midwicket. Ugly, brilliant power
oh well bowled, a fine yorker - even though it was slightly misdirected down leg. They manage to get a single anyway
four more! He shimmies to leg; he shimmies to off, but the yorker is wide and Boucher can't prevent four more byes
sliced over point but it falls short of the man lurking on the boundary
well wide, but not called a wide
a swing and a miss to end the innings
